title: Good Morning Britain's Kate Garraway 'signs up to I'm A Celebrity'
text:
Good Morning Britain’s Kate Garraway is ‘next star to sign up to I’m A Celebrity’ (Picture: Getty Images)

Good Morning Britain presenter Kate Garraway is said to be the next A-lister to have signed up to I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here!.

The star is thought to have pulled out of the show last year due to her hectic schedule – even though it was reported she was offered a whopping £150,000.

However, it seems she fancies her chances at becoming the Queen of the Jungle again, as a source claimed to The Sun the 52-year-old has booked time off work in order to start the show next month.

An ITV representative told Metro.co.uk that the reports are just ‘speculation’ and a full lineup will be released nearer transmission.

Back in March, Kate revealed how her two children Darcey, 13, and William, 10, were desperate to see her become a campmate.

It’s thought she turned it down last year (Picture: GC Images)

She said: ‘I think it’s completely terrifying but it’s also a brilliant show to watch, so I don’t know.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘My kids would love me to do it, I don’t know what that says.’

The reporter added: ‘People keep saying I’d be good in there and basically what that means is you want to see me tortured.

‘Like really close friends say, “Oh you’d be amazing, I really want you to do it.” And it’s like, “What have I done to you?”

Sources claim she has booked the time off work (Picture: Rex)

‘Does anybody want to go through that torture, I don’t know?’

And Kate’s not the only person rumoured to be on the show, as Roman Kemp has also refused to deny the speculation surrounding him.

‘Listen, I get asked to do thousands of shows like that all the time, it’s just about focusing on what I’ve got right now,’ he admitted to Metro.co.uk.

‘[The No Money Road Trip] is the biggest thing for me right now and there’s been such an amazing response, I can’t get over it to be honest.’

When asked if that’s a definite no for shows like I’m A Celeb at the moment, the 26-year-old laughed: ‘You’d have to see, you’d have to see.’

I’m A Celebrity returns to ITV1 this winter.

Got a showbiz story? If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.

description: Good Morning Britain's Kate Garraway is 'next star to sign up to I'm A Celebrity'.
